casebody.data:
COOPER
v.
BERGER, et al. 267P18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 29, 2018

John R. Wester, Charlotte, Attorney at Law, J. Dickson Phillips, III, Chapel Hill, Attorney at Law, Adam K. Doerr, Charlotte, Attorney at Law, Erik R. Zimmerman, Attorney at Law, Morgan P. Abbott, Chapel Hill, Attorney at Law, For Cooper, Roy A.

D. Martin Warf, Raleigh, Attorney at Law, For Berger, Philip E., et al.

Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, For North Carolina Bipartisan Board of Elections and Ethics Enforcement, et al.

Andrew H. Erteschik, Attorney at Law, Caroline P. Mackie, Raleigh, Attorney at Law, John Michael Durnovich, Attorney at Law, Wendy R. Weiser, Attorney at Law, Daniel I. Weiner, Attorney at Law, Douglas E. Keith, Attorney at Law, For Brennan Center for Justice at NYU School of Law and Democracy North Carolina

Daniel F.E. Smith, Attorney at Law, Jim W. Phillips, Jr., Greensboro, Attorney at Law, Charles E. Coble, Raleigh, Attorney at Law, For Hon. James G. Martin, et al.

Robert F. Orr, Asheville, Attorney at Law, For NC Professors of Constitutional Law

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 23rd of August 2018 by Brennan Center for Justice at NYU School of Law and Democracy North Carolina for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 29th of August 2018."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
